title: RS20787
content: The U.S. Army continues an ambitious program intended to transform itself into astrategically responsive forcedominant in all types of ground operations. As planned, its Future Force will eventually meld all ongoing initiativesinto a force based on a high-tech FutureCombat System (FCS). Its Current Force is beginning to provide a new combat capability, based oncurrent-technology armored vehicles, for the mid-intensitycombat operations that seem prevalent in today's world. Its current "legacy force" of existing systems is beingmodernized and maintained to ensure effectivelight and heavy force capabilities until the Future Force is realized. This short report briefly describes the programand discusses issues of feasibility, viability,and affordability of potential interest to Congress. It will be updated as events warrant.
